main event: On January 27, 1953, Major John F Duffy observed an unidentified flying object traveling in a general southwest to northeast direction over Tucson, Arizona.
interesting points: The object was approximately twice as large as the largest star in the sky.,It emitted no sound while flying at a very high rate of speed.,The sighting lasted about 20 seconds.,The observer was a communication officer with military experience and was an excellent observer.,There was no meteorological or astronomical explanation for the sighting.
witness description: Major John F Duffy, a communication officer with military experience.
